title: Modernize APIs for macOS 15+
description:
Now that we target macOS 15+, we can use modern SwiftUI APIs and remove workarounds.

Potential improvements:
1. Replace NavigationView with NavigationStack (iOS 16+/macOS 13+)
2. Remove .navigationViewStyle(.stack) - not needed with NavigationStack
3. Use .formStyle(.grouped) for Forms
4. Simplify #if os() conditionals where possible
5. Consider using .onChange(of:) with new signature
6. Use @Observable macro if appropriate (iOS 17+/macOS 14+)

Files to review:
- ShioriShare/InstructionsView.swift
- ShioriShare/SettingsView.swift
- ShioriShare/ShioriShareApp.swift
- ShareExtension/ShareViewController.swift
- Shared/URLExtractor.swift
close_reason: Completed modernization: NavigationStack, .formStyle(.grouped), cleaned up dead code. @Observable evaluation deferred to ss-hr8.4.

title: Simplify #if os() conditionals where code paths have converged
close_reason: Removed dead code (unused macOS playHapticFeedback stub). Most #if os() conditionals remain necessary due to platform-specific UI differences.

title: Evaluate @Observable macro for settings/state management
close_reason: Current @State and singleton pattern works well for this app's needs. @Observable would be beneficial for complex shared state objects, but our simple singletons (SettingsManager, KeychainHelper) with @State provide sufficient performance and clarity. No immediate need to refactor. Can revisit if state management becomes more complex.

macOS Share Extension: Replace UIKit with AppKit
description:
The ShareExtension currently uses UIKit which is not available on macOS. Need to:

1. Create a macOS-specific share extension target or use conditional compilation
2. Replace UIViewController with NSViewController
3. Replace UIHostingController with NSHostingController
4. Handle platform differences in the SwiftUI views (e.g., haptic feedback is iOS-only)
5. Test share extension works from Safari on macOS

Current error when building for macOS:
```
ShareViewController.swift:1:8: error: Unable to find module dependency: 'UIKit'
```

Options:
- Use #if os(iOS) / #if os(macOS) conditional compilation
- Create separate ShareExtension-macOS target
- Use Catalyst (but share extensions have limitations)
close_reason: Added conditional compilation for macOS support: replaced UIKit with AppKit, wrapped iOS-specific APIs (haptics, keyboard types, autocapitalization), duplicated URLExtractor methods for macOS
